Definition: In this task, you are given a tuple of Head and Tail events. The Head and Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether, as a result of the Head, PersonX will be seen as what is mentioned in the Tail. In this task, PersonX will be seen as the Tail if the Tail describes PersonX's persona or attribute as perceived by others given an event. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No".
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX gives PersonY the number<sep>Tail: Adventurous
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. As a result of the Head, PersonX will be seen as Adventurous.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX asks PersonY to say<sep>Tail: to observe PersonX
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, if PersonX asks PersonY to say, PersonX won't be seen as someone to observe PersonX. So this output is correct.
If PersonX eventually got something, personX will be seen as avenged. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX affords PersonY protection<sep>Tail: spends money
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX affords PersonY protection, PersonX won't be seen as someone who spends money. So the output should be "No".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX improves PersonY's ___ as understood<sep>Tail: intelligent
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX improves PersonY's ___ as understood, PersonX won't be seen as intelligent, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX finds PersonY answer<sep>Tail: Swell
Head: PersonX asks to play<sep>Tail: to relax  his mind
Head: PersonX asks for the moon<sep>Tail: to be demanding
Head: PersonX bases on PersonX's experience<sep>Tail: determined
Head: PersonX asks PersonY to say<sep>Tail: celebrate
Head: PersonX arranges a date<sep>Tail: gets to socialize romantically
Head: PersonX holds the ___ in PersonX's hand<sep>Tail: apprehensive
Head: PersonX goes camping during the weekend<sep>Tail: happy
